item.title: chemo overview
item.description: chemotherapy overview [[anthracyclines]] naturally occuring (“bicin”, “mycin”) ~8 proposed MOA limited by: myelosuppression cardiotoxicity (lifetime limits on doses) [[dirty data]], [[adverse effects]] [[risk mitigation]]: often the total lifetime dose of [[anthracyclines]] is unknown, e.

item.title: commonplace book
item.description: The [[Commonplace Book]] is not so much “commonplace” as it is a “common place” for gathering ideas. From [[loci communes]] of antiquity (maybe related to the memory palace?

item.title: Deep Work by Cal Newport
item.description: Deep Work by Cal Newport One of the chief things which my typical man has to learn is that the mental faculties are capable of a continuous hard activity; they do not tire like an arm or a leg.

item.title: Desert Fathers
item.description: On the individuality of worship A brother asked one of the elders: What good thing shall I do, and have life thereby?

item.title: dirty data
item.description: dirty data All data are dirty, but some are useful.

item.title: empiric antibiotics
item.description: Skin/soft tissue @eileen_hasse PO options staph: doxy linezolid clinda (diarrhea, often high levels of resistance) bactrim strep: keflex (true q6h dosing) cefadroxil (BID) amoxicillin augmentin (“amoxicillin plus diarrhea”) UTI Don’t treat UA w/o sx, unless pregnant or prior to urologic procedure.

item.title: equations in oncology
item.description: equations in oncology Standard Dose Intensity (SDI, amount rx) vs Delivered Dose Intensity (DDI, amount actually given), goal typically DDI/SDI >85% for curative therapies

item.title: Essentialism by Greg McKeown
item.description: Essentialism by Greg McKeown The crime which bankrupts men and states is that of job-work; declining from your main design to serve a turn here or there.

item.title: Finite and Infinite Games by James P. Carse
item.description: It is an invariable principle of all play, finite and infinite, that whoever plays, plays freely. Whoever must play, cannot play.

item.title: hemepath-capstone-2022-07-12
item.description: hematopathology capstone 20% other == high concern for malig, but no guaranteed results (e.g. mono can have tons of “other” cells)

item.description: I mean if you got a cat for one day, man I mean, if you, say, say, if you want a cat for 365 days, right

item.title: miscellaneous quotes
mistakes and systems
item.description: mistakes and systems Looking for systems that allowed for mistakes is a great idea, and [[Don Norman]] and [[Atul Gawande]] have done beautiful work defining this generally (Norman) and for medicine (Gawande).

item.title: oncology alphabet soup
item.description: abbreviations [[CTCAE]]: Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events link

item.title: pdf highlight colors
item.description: 🔴️ red –> disagree with author 🟠️ orange –> important point by author 🟡️ yellow –> interesting point 🟢️ green –> important to me 🔵️ blue –> notes after initial iteration 🟣️ magenta –> literary note to look up later

item.title: Prophylactic Antibiotics
item.description: Fluoroquinolones? LVQ classic in cancer patients, but some folks starting to use augmentin. @eileen_hasse

item.title: The Design of Everyday Things by Don Norman
item.description: The [[Design of Everyday Things]] by [[Don Norman]] A conceptual model is an explanation, usually highly simplified, of how something works.

item.description: ALL 2022-07-26 Kate Baker intro 2022-08-03 Vivek Patel mgmt overview of ALL PB flow: MPO -ve, TDT+, look for CD19, CD20, CD22 (see tx below)
